title: Former Clinton official says Elon Musk is out of control: 'He should be threatened'
content: Robert Reich, a former US labor secretary, calls for regulating Elon Musk's influence in his Guardian article. He suggests measures like boycotting Tesla and threatening legal action against Musk, citing allegations of foreign interference on X, Musk's platform. Reich's concerns align with Musk expressing interest in a future Trump administration.
summary: Robert Reich, a former US labor secretary, calls for regulating Elon Musk's influence in his Guardian article. He suggests measures like boycotting Tesla and threatening legal action against Musk, citing allegations of foreign interference on X, Musk's platform. Reich's concerns align with Musk expressing interest in a future Trump administration.

title: Ella Emhoff says she can't continue her knit club. It has something to do with Kamala Harris
content: In July, there was a security breach incident involving Ella Emhoff and a man who caused damage to vehicles belonging to two of Ella's protective details was arrested. Ella was inside a restaurant when the man damaged the cars waiting outside. Ella was escorted out of the restaurant and removed from the site. The incident took place close on the heels of the assassination attempt on Donald Trump for which the Secret Service came under fire.
summary: In July, there was a security breach incident involving Ella Emhoff and a man who caused damage to vehicles belonging to two of Ella's protective details was arrested. Ella was inside a restaurant when the man damaged the cars waiting outside. Ella was escorted out of the restaurant and removed from the site. The incident took place close on the heels of the assassination attempt on Donald Trump for which the Secret Service came under fire.

title: When Tulsi Gabbard revealed who actually runs the US govt: 'Neither Biden, nor Kamala...'
content: Tulsi Gabbard said the number of politicians who want to continue war is shocking. "They won't say I like war or I like to see more people dead, of course. They won't use those words but politicians with donors from defence companies want war," Tulsi Gabbard said. "It's like we are going to punish this bad guy, topple this regime...without thinking through the implications," Tulsi said.
summary: Tulsi Gabbard said the number of politicians who want to continue war is shocking. "They won't say I like war or I like to see more people dead, of course. They won't use those words but politicians with donors from defence companies want war," Tulsi Gabbard said. "It's like we are going to punish this bad guy, topple this regime...without thinking through the implications," Tulsi said.

title: 1 dead, several injured in Pittsburgh shooting, day after attack inside university
content: A shooting incident took place near a Speedway gas station in the suburbs of Pittsburg killing one and injuring several others. Multiple people were shot near the Speedway located on State Street in Clairton, southeast of Pittsburgh, police said. Three victims with gunshot wounds were found in the street. One man was transported to an area hospital in grave condition. He was pronounced deceased at the hospital, according to a report from Pittsburgh Public Safety.
summary: A shooting incident took place near a Speedway gas station in the suburbs of Pittsburg killing one and injuring several others. Multiple people were shot near the Speedway located on State Street in Clairton, southeast of Pittsburgh, police said. Three victims with gunshot wounds were found in the street. One man was transported to an area hospital in grave condition. He was pronounced deceased at the hospital, according to a report from Pittsburgh Public Safety.

title: Anger grows in Israel after Hamas kills 6 hostages; Netanyahu vows to 'settle score'
content: Israeli soldiers discovered the bodies of six hostages in a Gaza underground tunnel, brutally murdered by Hamas shortly before recovery. With 101 hostages still in Gaza, Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed retaliation. Amid rising violence in the West Bank, public pressure and protests mount in Israel for swift governmental action to secure the hostages' release.
summary: Israeli soldiers discovered the bodies of six hostages in a Gaza underground tunnel, brutally murdered by Hamas shortly before recovery. With 101 hostages still in Gaza, Prime Minister Netanyahu vowed retaliation. Amid rising violence in the West Bank, public pressure and protests mount in Israel for swift governmental action to secure the hostages' release.

title: Why Canada’s legalised marijuana sector is facing a sobering time
content: Canada may serve as a case study—good or bad—for other countries considering federal cannabis legalization. A Statistics Canada study from April revealed that over two-thirds of Canadian consumers who used cannabis in the past year purchased it legally.
summary: Canada may serve as a case study—good or bad—for other countries considering federal cannabis legalization. A Statistics Canada study from April revealed that over two-thirds of Canadian consumers who used cannabis in the past year purchased it legally.

title: In alarming sign, US military veterans split publicly over support for Donald Trump
content: A political division has emerged among military families after Donald Trump's visit to Arlington National Cemetery. Criticized for politicizing a solemn event, Trump defended his actions with supportive family videos. Vice President Kamala Harris condemned Trump, adding to the debate on who should be accountable for the Afghanistan debacle and what defines patriotism.
summary: A political division has emerged among military families after Donald Trump's visit to Arlington National Cemetery. Criticized for politicizing a solemn event, Trump defended his actions with supportive family videos. Vice President Kamala Harris condemned Trump, adding to the debate on who should be accountable for the Afghanistan debacle and what defines patriotism.

title: Melania asks husband to not use foul language like 's**t'. Donald Trump's reply is...
content: Donald Trump revealed his wife, Melania Trump, often urges him not to use foul language during his speeches. Evangelical leader Franklin Graham also advised him similarly. However, Trump finds it hard to substitute certain words. In Pennsylvania on Friday, Trump asked how should he frame a sentence like 'Everything she (Kamala Harris) touches turns to s**t'. “Every place she touches wouldn’t be nice?" Trump said explaining why he can't substitute some foul expressions.
summary: Donald Trump revealed his wife, Melania Trump, often urges him not to use foul language during his speeches. Evangelical leader Franklin Graham also advised him similarly. However, Trump finds it hard to substitute certain words. In Pennsylvania on Friday, Trump asked how should he frame a sentence like 'Everything she (Kamala Harris) touches turns to s**t'.  “Every place she touches wouldn’t be nice?" Trump said explaining why he can't substitute some foul expressions.

title: 'Kamala Harris looking more presidential. She lifts her chin...': Expression expert decodes CNN interview
content: Kamala Harris, recently nominated as the Democratic presidential candidate, gave her first CNN interview. While microexpressions expert Annie Särnblad saw her as increasingly presidential, body language experts like Susan Constantine and Greg Hartley criticised her for a lack of confidence and internal struggle that dominated her during the interview.
summary: Kamala Harris, recently nominated as the Democratic presidential candidate, gave her first CNN interview. While microexpressions expert Annie Särnblad saw her as increasingly presidential, body language experts like Susan Constantine and Greg Hartley criticised her for a lack of confidence and internal struggle that dominated her during the interview.

title: 'Your administration killed my son': Gold Star families blast Kamala Harris amid politics over Arlington row
content: In reply to Kamala Harris' dig, Donald Trump posted a series of videos from Gold Star parents who blamed Harris administration for the death of the soldiers. “I am Steve Nikoui, I am the father of Lance Corporal Kareem M. Nikoui. Your administration killed my son, deliberately in exchange for political theatrics so you could have a final day of the evacuation coinciding with September 11th," Nikoui said in a video.
summary: In reply to Kamala Harris' dig, Donald Trump posted a series of videos from Gold Star parents who blamed Harris administration for the death of the soldiers. “I am Steve Nikoui, I am the father of Lance Corporal Kareem M. Nikoui. Your administration killed my son, deliberately in exchange for political theatrics so you could have a final day of the evacuation coinciding with September 11th," Nikoui said in a video.

title: Remembering Hersh Goldberg-Polin: Soccer-loving Hamas hostage who braved live grenades
content: Described by his mother, Rachel Goldberg-Polin, as a “happy-go-lucky, laid back, good-humoured, respectful, and curious person,” Hersh was an elder brother to two sisters and deeply passionate about soccer, music, and travel. His childhood fascination with geography led him to collect atlases, globes, maps, and stacks of National Geographic magazines, filling his bedroom with symbols of his curiosity about the world. “He has been obsessed with geography and travel since he was a little boy,” Rachel said in a heartfelt speech at the Democratic National Convention (DNC).
summary: Described by his mother, Rachel Goldberg-Polin, as a “happy-go-lucky, laid back, good-humoured, respectful, and curious person,” Hersh was an elder brother to two sisters and deeply passionate about soccer, music, and travel. His childhood fascination with geography led him to collect atlases, globes, maps, and stacks of National Geographic magazines, filling his bedroom with symbols of his curiosity about the world. “He has been obsessed with geography and travel since he was a little boy,” Rachel said in a heartfelt speech at the Democratic National Convention (DNC).

title: Vladimir Putin gifts purebred horses to Kim Jong-Un after arms support for Ukraine war
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin gifts 24 Orlov Trotters to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, reflecting a deepening alliance. Reports indicate the horses are part of payment for artillery shells from North Korea aiding Russia's military efforts in Ukraine. This event underscores their growing military cooperation and significant geopolitical implications.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin gifts 24 Orlov Trotters to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, reflecting a deepening alliance. Reports indicate the horses are part of payment for artillery shells from North Korea aiding Russia's military efforts in Ukraine. This event underscores their growing military cooperation and significant geopolitical implications.

title: UN and Palestinian authorities launches massive polio vaccination campaign in war-torn Gaza
content: Palestinian health authorities and UN agencies have initiated an extensive polio vaccination campaign in Gaza, aiming to vaccinate about 640,000 children. The drive faces significant challenges due to ongoing conflict, destruction, and displacement. The initiative underscores the urgent need for a temporary truce to allow families to safely access health facilities.
summary: Palestinian health authorities and UN agencies have initiated an extensive polio vaccination campaign in Gaza, aiming to vaccinate about 640,000 children. The drive faces significant challenges due to ongoing conflict, destruction, and displacement. The initiative underscores the urgent need for a temporary truce to allow families to safely access health facilities.

title: 'Melania hates Donald, prefers Kamala Harris', claims Trump ex-aide
content: Anthony Scaramucci, a former Trump aide, said on the MediasTouch podcast that Melania Trump would prefer Kamala Harris to win the upcoming election, alleging that she hates her husband, Donald Trump. He used this assertion as a measure of Trump's unpopularity. Though maintaining a low profile since January 2021, sources claim Melania supports Trump's re-election campaign.
summary: Anthony Scaramucci, a former Trump aide, said on the MediasTouch podcast that Melania Trump would prefer Kamala Harris to win the upcoming election, alleging that she hates her husband, Donald Trump. He used this assertion as a measure of Trump's unpopularity. Though maintaining a low profile since January 2021, sources claim Melania supports Trump's re-election campaign.

title: Ukraine drones target refinery, power plants in Moscow, Tver regions, Russia says
content: Ukraine launched drone attacks on power and refinery plants in Moscow and Tver, sparking fires. Russia claimed its air defense units destroyed 158 drones overnight, with no casualties reported. This escalation comes as Ukraine seeks permission from the US to use allied-supplied weapons for deeper strikes inside Russia, aiming to disrupt Moscow’s war capabilities.
summary: Ukraine launched drone attacks on power and refinery plants in Moscow and Tver, sparking fires. Russia claimed its air defense units destroyed 158 drones overnight, with no casualties reported. This escalation comes as Ukraine seeks permission from the US to use allied-supplied weapons for deeper strikes inside Russia, aiming to disrupt Moscow’s war capabilities.

title: Florida teacher arrested for alleged abuse of autistic child at Forest Lake Elementary
content: A teacher in Volusia County with 36 years of experience faces a felony charge of child abuse after allegedly restraining a 3-year-old autistic student in a headlock. A paraeducator reported the incident, and the child showed physical distress. The teacher, Vilma Otero, is currently on administrative leave while the school district investigates.
summary: A teacher in Volusia County with 36 years of experience faces a felony charge of child abuse after allegedly restraining a 3-year-old autistic student in a headlock. A paraeducator reported the incident, and the child showed physical distress. The teacher, Vilma Otero, is currently on administrative leave while the school district investigates.

title: Pakistan's Karachi University deems high court judge's degree invalid after 40 years
content: The University of Karachi annulled the law degree of Islamabad high court Judge Tariq Mehmood Jahangiri, citing enrolment discrepancies from 1991. This decision came after the alleged detention of a syndicate member opposing the cancellation. The university discovered conflicting enrolment numbers, rendering the degree invalid.
summary: The University of Karachi annulled the law degree of Islamabad high court Judge Tariq Mehmood Jahangiri, citing enrolment discrepancies from 1991. This decision came after the alleged detention of a syndicate member opposing the cancellation. The university discovered conflicting enrolment numbers, rendering the degree invalid.

title: Trump vs Kamala: Mark Cuban asks netizens who should children emulate, here are the results
content: Mark Cuban, minority owner of the Dallas Mavericks, ignited a social media debate asking whether children should emulate Donald Trump or Kamala Harris, with Trump winning 68.9 per cent of the votes. Cuban, previously a Trump supporter, now favors Joe Biden and supports Harris's economic proposals, criticizing Trump in several posts.
summary: Mark Cuban, minority owner of the Dallas Mavericks, ignited a social media debate asking whether children should emulate Donald Trump or Kamala Harris, with Trump winning 68.9 per cent of the votes. Cuban, previously a Trump supporter, now favors Joe Biden and supports Harris's economic proposals, criticizing Trump in several posts.

title: 'Hamas leaders will pay': US President Biden expresses outrage after Israeli-American hostage found dead in Gaza tunnel
content: President Joe Biden expressed devastation over the recovery of six hostages' bodies, including an Israeli-American, from Gaza. He condemned Hamas and vowed to secure remaining hostages. Israeli forces retrieved the bodies, including American Hersh Goldberg-Polin. Vice President Kamala Harris and Israeli President Isaac Herzog also condemned Hamas's actions, calling for an end to the conflict.
summary: President Joe Biden expressed devastation over the recovery of six hostages' bodies, including an Israeli-American, from Gaza. He condemned Hamas and vowed to secure remaining hostages. Israeli forces retrieved the bodies, including American Hersh Goldberg-Polin. Vice President Kamala Harris and Israeli President Isaac Herzog also condemned Hamas's actions, calling for an end to the conflict.

title: ‘I’m getting kicked off because ...’: Man kicked off Delta Airlines flight for wearing offensive Trump shirt
content: A Delta Airlines passenger was removed from a flight at Sarasota Bradenton International Airport for wearing a shirt with an obscene depiction of former President Trump. He initially altered the shirt but reverted it before takeoff. This action led to his removal under Delta’s policy against offensive attire.
summary: A Delta Airlines passenger was removed from a flight at Sarasota Bradenton International Airport for wearing a shirt with an obscene depiction of former President Trump. He initially altered the shirt but reverted it before takeoff. This action led to his removal under Delta’s policy against offensive attire.
